data.title: How the English Football Pyramid system works – step by step
data.meta_description: From the bottom to the top, the FA Premier League to the Thames Valley Premier League, the English football league system explained
data.text:
The English Football Pyramid system is the structure of football divisions within the Football Associations’ remit and allows promotion and relegation from a County League right up to the Premier League.

It is known as the National League System (NLS), not to be confused with the National League which is a league within the NLS.

The system effectively covers at least 11 levels, more commonly referred to as ‘steps’ of which there are at least seven.

For example, the Cherry Red Records Combined Counties League Premier Division North is at level 9 league but step 5 overall while the Thames Valley Premier League is a step 7 league.

Competitions like the East Berks Football League and Hellenic League Division Two divisions do not appear in this as they are not part of the pyramid system currently.

The pyramid system underwent a major adjustment in the summer of 2021 after a delay due to Covid-19 but now means the pyramid (NLS) structure follows a 1-2-4-8-16 formation of divisions.

Related: How to qualify for the FA Cup

The new divisions created in the summer included the Combined Counties League Premier Division North.

Currently, the system works as follows from the bottom to the top:

Level 1: FA Premier League

Level 2: EFL Championship

Level 3: EFL League One

Level 4: EFL League Two

Level 5, Step 1: National League

Level 6, Step 2: National League North, National League South

Looking for the Women’s Football Pyramid? That’s right here

Level 7, Step 3:

Northern Premier League Premier Division

Southern League Premier Division Central

Southern League Premier Division South

Isthmian League Premier Division

Level 8, Step 4: (All divisions run in parallel)

Northern Premier League Division One East

Northern Premier League Division One West

Northern Premier League Division One Midlands (NEW)

Southern League Division One Central

Southern League Division One South

Isthmian League Division One North

Isthmian League Division One South Central

Isthmian League Division One East

Related: How Non League football tranfers work

Level 9, Step 5: (All divisions run in parallel)

Combined Counties League Premier Division North (NEW)

Combined Counties League Premier Division South

Eastern Counties League Premier Division

Essex Senior League

Hellenic League Premier Division

Midland Football League Premier Division

North West Counties League Premier Division

Northern Counties East League Premier Division

Northern League Division One

Southern Combination Football League Premier Division

Southern Counties East League Premier Division

Spartan South Midlands League Premier Division

United Counties League Premier Division North

United Counties League Premier Division South

Wessex League Premier Division

Western League Premier Division

Level 10, Step 6: (All divisions run in parallel)

Combined Counties League Division One

Eastern Counties League Division One North

Eastern Counties League Division One South

Hellenic League Division One

Midland Football League Division One

North West Counties League First Division North

North West Counties League First Division South

Northern Counties East League Division One

Northern League Division Two

South West Peninsula League Premier Division East

South West Peninsula League Premier Division West

Southern Combination Football League Division One

Southern Counties East League Division One

Spartan South Midlands League Division One

United Counties League Division One

Wessex League Division One

Western League Division One

Related: An explanation of ‘Dual Registrations’ in non league football

Level 11, Step 7: (All divisions run in parallel)
